intro: Acomis, commonly known as the beardtongue, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. These plants are native to North America and are characterized by their distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Acomis species typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They produce small, often blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
